creditline: Gift from the Helen D. Ling Collection in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Art
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: five children playing at a white table outdoors; smallest child wearing pink tunic and green pants, seen from back, seated on a small stool facing objects on table; child wearing red robe and blue shoes at left looks at smallest child; child in blue robe and child in yellow tunic, with his arm around previous child, lean over end of table at center; child wearing black hat and pale maroon tunic holding a spouted vessel approaches table at right; crane figurine and rock-like object on table at right; green, tan and blue vertical rock formation at left, with some bamboo branches with leaves; white fence behind children; inscription in black at left edge with two red square seals
text:
Wang Qinyun, a renowned woman poet and painter of the late 18th century, painted
fifteen scenes of children at play in garden settings in this album. The children’s activities include riding on bamboo horses, playing gambling games, performing acrobatics, exercising archery, performing ritualistic parades, playing grass games, bird fighting, playing board games, skipping robe, staging scenes of the success in civil service examination, fishing, enjoying antiquities, fighting, attending school, and building a snowman. These paintings reveal a firm grasp of minute details in the depictions of the children, and even the garden scenes are exceptionally depicted. The colophons accompanying each painting were written by contemporary or later writers, poets and calligraphers. They provide valuable additional information not found in the painting proper.
title: Children playing at a table outdoors
